R0088.title: Automated Login Risk
R0088.definition: The identity authentication login process can be automated, creating security risks.
R0088.description: Automated login risk refers to the use of automated scripts, bots, or software to execute the login process, potentially involving a range of security threats and issues.
R0088.influence: Can lead to credential cracking (R0032), credential stuffing (R0032-001), and other cyberattacks; can also be used for automated account seasoning (R0034) and third-party account aggregation (R0037), making it a priority defense target.
